email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vessel for Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hi Emily,

We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 50,000MT of coal from Newcastle, Australia, to Shanghai, China. The cargo needs to be shipped on CIF terms. Could you provide a quote and confirm vessel availability for a laycan of 20-25 October?

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thank you for your inquiry. I can offer the vessel MV OCEAN STAR, DWT 75,000, LOA 225m, currently available for your cargo. The starting freight rate is USD 25 per MT. Laycan is 20-25 October. Let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Emily

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hi Emily,

Thanks for the quick response. USD 25 per MT seems a bit high given the current market conditions. Can you offer a better rate? Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate and loading window?

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Given the current market, I can reduce the rate to USD 23 per MT. The demurrage rate is USD 15,000 per day, pro rata. The loading window is 96 hours. Please let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Emily

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hi Emily,

USD 23 per MT sounds reasonable. Can we lock in the MV OCEAN STAR with a laycan of 20-25 October? Please send over the charter party for review.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Charter Party for MV OCEAN STAR
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Great, I'll proceed with the booking. Attached is the charter party for your review. Let me know if you need any adjustments.

Best regards,
Emily

email_chain.subject: Re: Fwd: Charter Party for MV OCEAN STAR
email_chain.body:
Hi Emily,

The charter party looks good. We'll proceed as discussed. Thanks for your help!

Best regards,
John
